title: Airpods clones that sound GOOD?? - Soundcore Liberty Air 2 Earbuds
description:
Thanks to Soundcore for sponsoring this video! Check out the Soundcore Liberty Air 2 earbuds at https://bit.ly/LibertyAir2LTT

Which true wireless earbuds are the best for you? You somewhat need to go wireless due to the headphone jack no longer available and for under $100, you should check these out.

So they've got Diamond Coated Drivers, whatever that means. They've got two microphones per earbud, so for uplink noise cancellation, they've got IPX five water resistance, so you should be able to sweat with them in. And they feature seven hours of playtime in the earbuds themselves with a total of 28 hours with the charging case. And this is a really nice feature to have now, they've got wireless charging in the case as well. I really didn't think it was going to bother me that much. And then I went to a pair of wireless earphones that did not have wireless charging built into the case and I was like, "oh yeah, this really isn't as good". So if they're not charged out of the box, then that should give me enough to do the video here. And they're preloaded with the medium ear tips, actually that means I'm probably going to have to swap them out right away, I have kind of small ear canals. All right, let's see what the fit feels like. Okay, small it is. Last thing in here is a charging cable just in case you, still plugging in to charge. Type C, really nice to see, get it, really nice to see. (laughs) Got them, on the bottom we've got a pairing button and then that's like pretty much it there about as, AirPods like as you could expect them to be, without being like a, you know, a cheap knockoff, right? For size comparison, I brought along my regular AirPods as well as a pair of AirPods Pros. Of course the most important thing for me is not necessarily the raw size, but whether they fit in the useless pocket. Ooh, it's a little tight, does get in there though.
